Details: Personal Data" means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person.
Processing" means any operation performed on Personal Data.
Controller" means the entity which determines the purposes and means of Processing.
Processor" means the entity which Processes Personal Data on behalf of the Controller.
The Processor shall Process Personal Data only on documented instructions from the Controller.
Processing shall be for the purposes specified in Annex A.
The Processor shall inform the Controller if instructions appear to infringe data protection laws.
Personal Data shall be:
Processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner.
Collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes.
Adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary.
Accurate and kept up to date.
Kept for no longer than necessary.
Processed securely with appropriate technical and organisational measures.
The Controller confirms that Processing has a lawful basis under Article 6:
Consent from the Data Subject
Necessary for contract performance
Necessary for legal compliance
Necessary to protect vital interests
Necessary for public interest tasks
Necessary for legitimate interests
Where Processing relies on consent:
Consent shall be freely given, specific, informed and unambiguous.
Data Subjects can withdraw consent at any time.
Withdrawal shall be as easy as giving consent.
Processing of special categories requires explicit consent or other legal basis under Article 9(2).
Enhanced security measures apply to special category data.
Information about Processing shall be provided in concise, transparent, intelligible form using clear language.
When collecting directly from Data Subjects (Article 13):
Controller identity and contact details
DPO contact details if applicable
Purposes and legal basis for Processing
Recipients of Personal Data
Retention periods
Data Subject rights (Articles 15-22)
Right to withdraw consent
Right to lodge complaint with supervisory authority
The Processor shall assist the Controller in responding to Data Subject requests:
Confirmation of Processing and copy of data.
Correction of inaccurate data.
Deletion when no longer necessary.
Limiting Processing in certain circumstances.
Receiving data in machine-readable format.
Objecting to Processing on legitimate interest grounds.
Requests shall be responded to within one month.
The Processor shall:
Process only on documented Controller instructions.
Ensure personnel confidentiality.
Implement appropriate security measures.
Engage Sub-processors with Controller consent.
Assist Controller with Data Subject requests.
Assist with security and breach obligations.
Delete or return data upon termination.
Provide information to demonstrate compliance.
The Processor shall not engage Sub-processors without prior authorization.
Approved Sub-processors are listed in Annex B.
The Processor shall inform Controller of Sub-processor changes.
Sub-processor agreements shall impose equivalent obligations.
Transfers outside the EEA require:
Adequacy decision; or
Appropriate safeguards (Standard Contractual Clauses, Binding Corporate Rules)
Standard Contractual Clauses apply to transfers listed in Annex B.
The Processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures:
Pseudonymisation and encryption
Ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience
Ability to restore availability after incidents
Regular testing and evaluation of measures
Security measures are detailed in Annex C.
The Processor shall notify the Controller without undue delay upon becoming aware of a breach.
Notification shall describe:
Nature of the breach
Categories and numbers affected
Likely consequences
Measures to address the breach
The Controller shall notify the supervisory authority within 72 hours if required.
Data Subjects shall be notified if the breach poses high risk.
The Controller shall conduct DPIA for high-risk Processing.
The Processor shall assist by providing:
Description of Processing operations
Assessment of necessity and proportionality
Risks to Data Subject rights
Mitigation measures
The Processor has designated a Data Protection Officer: Contact: dpo@processor.com
The DPO shall:
Inform and advise on GDPR obligations
Monitor compliance
Advise on DPIAs
Cooperate with supervisory authority
Act as contact point
The Processor shall maintain records of Processing activities including:
Name and contact details
Categories of Processing
International transfers
Security measures description
The Controller may audit the Processor's compliance.
The Processor shall provide access to documentation, facilities and personnel.
Reasonable notice shall be provided unless urgent circumstances exist.
